My mom got hers generated after her last visit to AIIMS Delhi; she's got UHID: 19850615-2468-1234, something like that. And get this, it's meant to link up all your health records across different hospitals and clinics. Fingers crossed that actually happens smoothly!

unnormalised: Don't forget about your TPA ID! TPAs, or Third Party Administrators, act as intermediaries between you and the insurance company, especially during claims processing. If your insurance policy uses a TPA, you'll usually have a TPA ID card with a unique identifier. My uncle has one from Paramount TPA, his ID is something like P1234567. This ID helps the hospital and TPA quickly identify your insurance details and process your claim faster.

Some insurers are moving to digital health cards, making it even easier to access your policy details. For example, Bajaj Allianz might issue a health card with the number BAC/HC/2024/12345.
